title: Ozzy Osbourne Honored Posthumously at The Brit Awards
summary: Heavy metal icon Ozzy Osbourne will be posthumously awarded a Lifetime Achievement award at The Brit Awards in Manchester. The singer, who died in July, will be recognized for his decades-long career, including his role in Black Sabbath and solo work. A tribute performance curated by his wife Sharon Osbourne and fronted by Robbie Williams will close the ceremony, featuring musicians from Ozzy's band. The Brit Awards, hosted by Jack Whitehall, are being held outside London for the first time. Ozzy's legacy includes over 100 million album sales, Grammy awards, and inductions into music halls of fame. Stacey Tang of the Brit Awards Committee praised his unique voice and influence on rock music. Other performers at the event include artists like Harry Styles and Raye.

background_read: Ozzy Osbourne was a pioneering figure in heavy metal music, known for his work with Black Sabbath and as a solo artist. He passed away in July, leaving behind a legacy marked by numerous awards, including Grammys and hall of fame inductions. The Brit Awards are a major UK music ceremony that honors artists; this year, they are breaking tradition by moving to Manchester. The tribute performance involves collaboration between family and friends, highlighting Ozzy's enduring impact on the music industry.
